info.description: This API allows Blitz customers to place orders for new numbers, retrieve inventory, cancel numbers, request trunk group modifications, reroute numbers between existing trunk groups, request reports, and perform account management functions. | Contact your Blitz account representative for access.
info.title: Blitz Customer API

post.description: Perform a search across numbers assigned to the customer through the API.  Numbers ordered on the same day will not appear.

page.description: OPTIONAL - The page number. (used for pagination)

pageSize.description: OPTIONAL - Records per page. (used for pagination)

trunkGroup.description: OPTIONAL - search for numbers on a specific trunk group

prefix.description: OPTIONAL - Returns numbers beginning with the prefix - no country code

suffix.description: OPTIONAL - Returns numbers ending with the suffix

pattern.description: OPTIONAL - Returns numbers containing the specified pattern

rateCenter.description: OPTIONAL - Returns numbers in the provided rate center - use LERG standard abbreviations

state.description: OPTIONAL - Returns numbers in the provided state or province - use LERG standard two character abbreviations

lata.description: OPTIONAL - Returns numbers in the provided lata - three digit lata only

post.summary: Creates a request to cancel a group of numbers.
post.description: Creates a request to cancel a group of numbers.  This work is reviewed manually, so no immediate status is available from the API.  The customer will be emailed order tracking information and confirmation once completed.

202.description: The server accepted the request and will execute it later.

post.description: Perform a search across all available numbers in the system.

page.description: OPTIONAL - The page number. (used for pagination)

pageSize.description: OPTIONAL - Records per page. (used for pagination)

prefix.description: OPTIONAL - Returns numbers beginning with the prefix - no country code

suffix.description: OPTIONAL - Returns numbers ending with the suffix

pattern.description: OPTIONAL - Returns numbers containing the specified pattern

rateCenter.description: OPTIONAL - Returns numbers in the provided rate center - use LERG standard abbreviations

state.description: OPTIONAL - Returns numbers in the provided state or province - use LERG standard two character abbreviations

lata.description: OPTIONAL - Returns numbers in the provided lata - three digit lata only

onNet.description: OPTIONAL - Returns on-net only unless set to 0

post.summary: Creates an order for the numbers specified and adds numbers to routing to the specified trunk group. A maximum of 25 numbers can be submitted at once. For larger orders submit multiple API requests to reserve the total quantity needed.

routeLabel.description: Customer's trunk group where number(s) should be routed

get.summary: Gets the details of a specific order.
get.description: Retrieves the details of an order and returns details and numbers reserved.

post.summary: Creates a request to add CNAME to a group of numbers.
post.description:
Creates a request to add CNAME to a group of numbers.  This work is done manually, so no 
immediate status is available from the API.  The customer will be emailed order tracking 
information.  The same caller name will be applied to all numbers submitted.

callerName.description: The caller name.  May not contain profanity or generic phrases such as 'restricted'.

202.description: The server accepted the request and will execute it later.

get.description:
Currently active trunk groups will be returned. Customer can use the trunk group number to order
new numbers, make trunk group changes, or rerouted assigned numbers.

post.description:
Creates a request to add CNAME a new trunk group.  This work is scheduled, so no 
immediate status is available from the API.  The customer will be emailed order tracking 
information.

ipAddresses.description: json object of the TG that should be built

202.description: The server accepted the request and will execute it later.

post.summary: Request a change to an existing trunk group.
post.description:
Creates a request to add CNAME a new trunk group.  This work is scheduled, so no 
immediate status is available from the API.  The customer will be emailed order tracking 
information.

trunkNumber.description: Number of an existing trunk group assigned to the customer.  The trunk group will be modified to reflect the data passed in the trunkGroup object.

ipAddresses.description: json object of the TG that should be built

202.description: The server accepted the request and will execute it later.

post.summary: Routes previously assigned numbers to an existing customer trunk group.
post.description: Routes previously assigned numbers to an existing customer trunk group.

routeLabel.description: Number of an existing trunk group assigned to the customer.  The trunk group will be modified to reflect the data passed in the trunkGroup object.

200.description: The server accepted the request and will execute it later.

post.summary: Creates a CSV export of assigned numbers.
post.description:
Creates a CSV export of assigned numbers.  The CSV file will not be returned via the API 
but will be queued and uploaded to the customer's Blitz-provided SFTP account.  An email
will be sent to the specified used upon report completion.

additionalEmail.description: Optional additional email recipient to notify at the time of report completion.

202.description: The server accepted the request and will execute it later.

post.description:
Creates a CSV export of Blitz's footprint.  The CSV file will not be returned via the API 
but will be queued and uploaded to the customer's Blitz-provided SFTP account.  An email
will be sent to the specified used upon report completion.

additionalEmail.description: Optional additional email recipient to notify at the time of report completion.

202.description: The server accepted the request and will execute it later.

post.summary: Creates a CSV export of CDRS.
post.description:
Creates a CSV export of CDRs.  The CSV file will not be returned via the API 
but will be queued and uploaded to the customer's Blitz-provided SFTP account.  An email
will be sent to the specified used upon report completion.
|
A maximum of one day's CDRs may be requested per request, and the date must be in the past (CDRs 
are not available until the next day).

requestedDate.description: Date for which CDRs should be pulled.

requestedNumber.description: Optional telephone number if you wish to limit results to a single number. Should be a ten-digits only without country code.

additionalEmail.description: Optional additional email recipient to notify at the time of report completion.

202.description: The server accepted the request and will execute it later.

post.summary: Submits an LNP request to port a number.
post.description:
Creates a request to port a number to Blitz.  This work is done manually, so no 
immediate status is available from the API.  The customer will be emailed order tracking 
information.  The same caller name will be applied to all numbers submitted.

routeLabel.description: Customer's trunk group where number(s) should be routed

company.description: Company name (or individual name on the bill if residential).  Must match losing carrier's info

streetAddress.description: Physical address, not PO Box.  Must match losing carrier's info

city.description: City.  Must match losing carrier's info

state.description: State.  Must match losing carrier's info

postalCode.description: Zip or Postal Code.  Must match losing carrier's info

authName.description: Person's name on the account who is authorized to move tn

authPhone.description: Contact phone number of person who is authorized to move tn

BTN.description: BTN (billing telephone number) for numbers porting

currentAccountNumber.description: Current billing account number (if available on bill)

requestedFOC.description: Not guaranteed - if blank soonest port date will be arranged

202.description: The server accepted the request and will execute it later.

NotFound.description: The specified resource was not found

NumbersObject.description: A list of numbers on which an action should be performed.

partialFulfillment.description: if set to true, total number of numbers available was less than the requested quantity

routeLabel.description: Customer's trunk group where number(s) were routed
Customer's trunk group where number(s) were routed

sourceIP.description: IP where request originated - for tracking and audit purposes.  This is NOT where a number is routed.

number.description: matching telephone number in 10 digit format (no country code)

rateCenter.description: rate center - using LERG standard abbreviations

ErroredNumbers.description: numbers not succesfully ordered or routed

failedNumber.description: matching telephone number in 10 digit format (no country code)

number.description: matching telephone number in 10 digit format (no country code)

rateCenter.description: rate center - using LERG standard abbreviations

onNet.description: indicates whether a number qualifies as on-net (1 for yes, 0 for no)

routeLabel.description: Customer's trunk group where number(s) were routed

trunkNumber.description: Number of an existing trunk group assigned to the customer.  The trunk group will be modified to reflect the data passed in the trunkGroup object.
